section.title: Build and run a development installation
section.simpara: These steps install numerous dependencies required to build and run a development installation of Eureka Streams. This procedure is based on the instructions at http://www.eurekastreams.org/build-and-run/.

section.title: Install prerequisite packages
section.simpara: These steps use sudo to run commands as root. You could also run sudo -i to become root.

listitem.screen: sudo yum -y install memcached sudo /sbin/service memcached start sudo /sbin/chkconfig memcached on
sudo yum -y install postgresql postgresql-server sudo /sbin/service postgresql initdb sudo /sbin/service postgresql start sudo /sbin/chkconfig postgresql on

section.title: Install and configure Maven
section.simpara: These steps install Maven2 using the binary distribution from the Apache web site.

listitem.simpara: Click on the link for the current version of Maven2 to see a list of download mirrors
The top of the page suggests a mirror based on your IP
Download the tarball using your browser, curl, or wget
List the contents of the tarball
With my download, the tarball contains:
listitem.screen: apache-maven-2.2.1/boot/classworlds-1.1.jar apache-maven-2.2.1/LICENSE.txt apache-maven-2.2.1/NOTICE.txt apache-maven-2.2.1/README.txt apache-maven-2.2.1/bin/m2.conf apache-maven-2.2.1/bin/mvn.bat apache-maven-2.2.1/bin/mvnDebug.bat apache-maven-2.2.1/bin/mvn apache-maven-2.2.1/bin/mvnDebug apache-maven-2.2.1/conf/ apache-maven-2.2.1/conf/settings.xml apache-maven-2.2.1/lib/maven-2.2.1-uber.jar

listitem.simpara: Optionally, download the PDF documentation for offline viewing

note.simpara: If you have not setup /etc/sudoers, use su -

section.simpara: These steps compile and install the Eureka Streams source code.

pushd /opt/eurekastreams git add myprefs.sh git commit -m 'save my preferences'
